simulator.framework
Class ReflectionFactory

java.lang.Object
  simulator.framework.ReflectionFactory

public class ReflectionFactory
extends java.lang.Object

A facade that provides a simple interface for instantiating objects, finding methods, and invoking methods.

createObjectFromMixed

public java.lang.Object createObjectFromMixed(java.lang.String className,
                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> packagePath,
                                              java.lang.Object[] parameters,
                                              java.lang.String[] strings)
                                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This class can be used to create objects from a mixture of pre-existing objects and String parameters The parameters and strings arrays must be the same length, and they must be mutually exclusive, i.e. for a given index value, one of the arrays must have a null value, and the other must be non-null.

Parameters:
className -
packagePath -
parameters - array of objects to pass as parameters
strings - array of string arguments
Returns:
the object constructed using the given parameters.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class does not exist.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters don't fit with the class or the parameters and strings arrays are inconsistent

getMethod

public java.lang.reflect.Method getMethod(java.lang.Class<?> theClass,
                                          java.lang.String methodName,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                                   throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
Get a method from the given class that matches the argument list. The matching is done by trying to parse the strings into the types of each argument in the method.

Parameters:
theClass - target class to search for methods
methodName - name of method
args - list of string arguments
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException

createFromFactoryMethod

public java.lang.Object createFromFactoryMethod(java.lang.String className,
                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> packagePaths,
                                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                                         throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Use this method to create an object from a static factory method. E.g. HallCallButtonPayload.getWriteablePayload()

Parameters:
className - name of the class to search for the method on
packagePaths - paths to search when creating the class
methodName - the method name
args - arguments to pass to the method
Returns:
an object that is returned by the static method
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

invoke

public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.reflect.Method theMethod,
                               java.lang.Object obj,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                               java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Call the given method on the given object using the arguments in the args list. This call assumes that the argument list was verfied when creating the method, so an exception will be thrown if the args are inapprprpriate.

Parameters:
theMethod -
obj - object to call the method on -- can be null if it is a static method.
args -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
